Enjoy the Traverse City Cherry Festival

The Cherry Festival, held annually in Traverse City, Michigan, is a vibrant celebration of all things cherry-related. Typically spanning a week in early to mid-summer, this beloved event attracts visitors from far and wide to revel in the region's bountiful cherry harvest. The festival takes place throughout downtown Traverse City, with various activities and events scattered across the city's picturesque streets and waterfront areas. From cherry-themed parades and concerts to pie-eating contests and farmers' markets, there's something for everyone to enjoy at this lively festival.

What to Wear

During the Cherry Festival, Traverse City experiences warm and sunny weather typical of summer in Northern Michigan. Temperatures often range from the mid-70s to low 80s Fahrenheit (around 24-28 degrees Celsius), making it the perfect time to soak up the sunshine and indulge in outdoor festivities. To beat the summer heat, visitors are advised to dress comfortably in lightweight, breathable clothing such as shorts, t-shirts, and sundresses. Don't forget to bring sunscreen, sunglasses, and a hat to protect yourself from the sun's rays while exploring the festival grounds.
